channel.title: Burning Dvds?
channel.description:
Well I just downloaded a 300 Dvd Screener - good quality :D
Well I was wondering can someone tell me in a detailed tutorial or give a link to one on how to burn it to a Dvd cd so i can play it on the dvd player..
I have a dvd burner on my computer and tons of Dvd-R cds.
The file is in two parts..so thinking 2 cds?
How do I do this?
Please and thanks!
(Also what program to use and such )

item.title: Burning Dvds?
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

I did it like 3days ago,I converted using convertXtoDvd and then burnt with Nero 7, part per disc.Thanks for all the help,except YourDistracted’s pointless post.

Read full topic

item.description:
@N00b1 wrote:

i had this prob and gave up i used nero 7 and the sound was relay squeaky and fast

item.title: Burning Dvds?
item.dc:creator: @MybJames MybJames
item.description:
@MybJames wrote:

use nero

when you say two parts, what the hell do you mean.

I use ConvertXtoDVD, download that and crack it.

Run your .avi or whatever it is you got into that program, hit convert and make sure you have a dvd+r cd in your drive, done.

Read full topic

item.description:
@system wrote:

Okay thanks,anyone know any good tuts?[br][size=1]Posted on: March 27, 2007, 06:10:07 PM[/size][hr]Anyone please?

item.title: Burning Dvds?
item.dc:creator: @jme jme
item.description:
@jme wrote:

I have downloaded well over 200 movies now, and burnt over 50. I use Nero 7. It’s pretty much all straight forward and will convert just about any movie format with any codec to the DVD format and burn it. It does however cost money unless you find a crack or something. I just downloaded the trial version and searched for a serial number on www.serials.ws(beware of porn ads, and don’t download anything)

Read full topic
